definitions.text: make something new, such as a product or a mental or artistic creation
examples: Her company developed a new kind of building material that withstands all kinds of weather
They developed a new technique

definitions.text: work out
examples: We have developed a new theory of evolution

definitions.text: gain through experience
examples: I acquired a strong aversion to television
Children must develop a sense of right and wrong
Dave developed leadership qualities in his new position
develop a passion for painting

definitions.text: come to have or undergo a change of (physical features and attributes)
examples: He grew a beard
The patient developed abdominal pains
I got funny spots all over my body
Well-developed breasts

definitions.text: come into existence; take on form or shape
examples: A new religious movement originated in that country
a love that sprang up from friendship
the idea for the book grew out of a short story
An interesting phenomenon uprose

definitions.text: change the use of and make available or usable
examples: develop land
The country developed its natural resources
The remote areas of the country were gradually built up

definitions.text: elaborate, as of theories and hypotheses
examples: Could you develop the ideas in your thesis

definitions.text: create by training and teaching
examples: The old master is training world-class violinists
we develop the leaders for the future

definitions.text: be gradually disclosed or unfolded; become manifest
examples: The plot developed slowly

definitions.text: grow, progress, unfold, or evolve through a process of evolution, natural growth, differentiation, or a conducive environment
examples: A flower developed on the branch
The country developed into a mighty superpower
The embryo develops into a fetus
This situation has developed over a long time

definitions.text: become technologically advanced
examples: Many countries in Asia are now developing at a very fast pace
Viet Nam is modernizing rapidly

definitions.text: cause to grow and differentiate in ways conforming to its natural development
examples: The perfect climate here develops the grain
He developed a new kind of apple

definitions.text: generate gradually
examples: We must develop more potential customers
develop a market for the new mobile phone

definitions.text: grow emotionally or mature
examples: The child developed beautifully in her new kindergarten
When he spent a summer at camp, the boy grew noticeably and no longer showed some of his old adolescent behavior

definitions.text: make visible by means of chemical solutions
examples: Please develop this roll of film for me

definitions.text: superimpose a three-dimensional surface on a plane without stretching, in geometry
move one's pieces into strategically more advantageous positions
examples: Spassky developed quickly

definitions.text: move into a strategically more advantageous position
examples: develop the rook

definitions.text: elaborate by the unfolding of a musical idea and by the working out of the rhythmic and harmonic changes in the theme
examples: develop the melody and change the key

definitions.text: happen
examples: Report the news as it develops
These political movements recrudesce from time to time

definitions.text: expand in the form of a series
examples: Develop the function in the following form
